title: MCI Triage - Priority Decision
pcr_text: Multi-vehicle accident with 8 victims. You have 4 immediate patients requiring transport. Which patient gets transported first?
correct_error: MCI triage priority. Transport most critical patient first per START triage protocol.

options.text: Patient with respiratory arrest and pulse

options.feedback: INCORRECT PRIORITY! Respiratory arrest takes precedence over minor injuries in MCI triage.

title: Radio Report Content
pcr_text: En route with critical STEMI patient. What key elements must be included in your radio report to receiving hospital?
correct_error: Complete radio report. Include patient condition, ETA, and special requirements per communications protocol.

options.text: Age, chief complaint, vital signs, ETA, and equipment needs
Just the chief complaint and ETA
options.feedback: INCOMPLETE REPORT! Full patient status required for hospital preparation.

title: Patient Refusal - Medico-Legal
pcr_text: 45-year-old male with mild chest pain refuses transport despite your recommendation. He is alert and oriented. What is your legal obligation?
correct_error: Patient refusal. Document assessment, obtain signature, and provide written refusal form per medico-legal protocol.

options.text: Document assessment, explain risks, obtain written refusal

options.feedback: ILLEGAL! Cannot transport competent adults against their will.

title: Safe Lifting Technique
pcr_text: Moving unconscious 250lb patient from floor to stretcher. What is the safest lifting technique?
correct_error: Safe lifting. Use proper body mechanics and team lifting per safety protocols.

options.text: Use power grip, bend at knees, keep load close to body
Bend at waist and lift with arms only
options.feedback: DANGEROUS! Causes back injury. Use proper lifting mechanics.

title: Transport vs Treat - Critical Patient
pcr_text: 28-year-old male with gunshot wound to chest, respiratory distress, 2 minute transport time. Should you treat on scene or transport immediately?
correct_error: Load and go decision. Transport critical patients immediately per trauma protocols.

options.feedback: DELAYS CARE! Critical trauma patients need immediate transport.

title: Hotspot: Landing Zone Selection
pcr_text: Air ambulance requested for critical patient. Which area would you designate as the landing zone?
correct_error: Safe landing zone. Select open, flat area away from obstacles per aviation safety protocols.

options.text: Open field 100ft x 100ft, clear of obstacles

options.feedback: UNSAFE LZ! Must be clear of all obstacles and vehicles.

title: MCI Triage Tag Application
pcr_text: During MCI, you encounter a patient with agonal respirations and weak pulse. What triage tag should be applied?
correct_error: MCI triage tagging. Red tag for immediate priority per START protocol.

options.feedback: INCORRECT TAG! Agonal respirations require immediate intervention.

title: Radio Report Timing
pcr_text: En route with stable patient. When should you provide radio update to dispatch?
correct_error: Radio communications. Update dispatch at key points per communications protocol.

options.text: At scene departure, major intersections, and hospital arrival

options.feedback: INADEQUATE COMMUNICATIONS! Regular updates required for safety.

title: DNR Documentation - Legal
pcr_text: Elderly patient with DNR bracelet found unresponsive. Family confirms wishes. What documentation is required?
correct_error: DNR protocol. Confirm validity and document per medico-legal requirements.

options.text: Confirm bracelet validity, contact physician if needed, document in PCR

options.feedback: VIOLATES DNR! Must confirm validity before withholding care.

title: Safe Lifting - Team Coordination
pcr_text: Moving obese patient down narrow stairs. How should your team coordinate the lift?
correct_error: Team lifting. Assign roles and communicate clearly per safety protocols.

options.text: Designate leader, count to 3, lift simultaneously

title: Transport vs Treat - Minor Injury
pcr_text: 15-year-old with ankle sprain, able to bear weight, 20 minute transport time. Should you treat on scene or transport?
correct_error: Stay and play decision. Treat minor injuries on scene when appropriate per protocols.

options.text: Treat on scene with splinting and education

options.feedback: UNNECESSARY TRANSPORT! Minor injuries can be treated on scene.

title: Hotspot: Triage Area Setup
pcr_text: Setting up MCI triage area. Where should you place the treatment area?
correct_error: MCI zone setup. Position treatment area safely away from hazards per MCI protocols.

options.text: Upwind, uphill from hot zone with easy access

options.feedback: UNSAFE LOCATION! Treatment area must be in warm zone, away from hazards.

title: Medico-Legal: Assault Documentation
pcr_text: Patient admits to being assaulted but refuses police involvement. What is your documentation requirement?
correct_error: Assault documentation. Document injuries and report suspicions per mandatory reporting laws.

options.text: Document all injuries and circumstances, report to authorities
Respect patient wishes and don't document
options.feedback: ILLEGAL! Mandatory reporting laws require documentation and reporting.

title: Radio Report - Critical Update
pcr_text: Patient condition deteriorating en route. What information must be included in urgent radio update?
correct_error: Urgent radio update. Include current status and ETA changes per communications protocol.

options.text: Current vital signs, interventions performed, ETA

options.feedback: INCOMPLETE UPDATE! Specific status information required.

title: Safe Lifting - Equipment Use
pcr_text: Moving patient with suspected spinal injury. What lifting device should be used?
correct_error: Spinal injury lifting. Use long board or scoop stretcher per trauma protocols.
